titles.title: Recognizing the historical significance of Historic Virginia Key Beach Park of Miami, Florida.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.
Mr. Grijalva moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 361.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands
committee.name: House Natural Resources

bill.summary: 9/8/2009--Passed House amended. Recognizes: (1) the historical, cultural, and recreational significance of Historic Virginia Key Beach Park of Miami, Florida; and (2) the significance of the African-American community's struggle for equality through its collaborative efforts to preserve this historic site.
